sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
briefTitle: Bangkok Tenofovir Study, an HIV Pre-exposure Prophylaxis Trial, Bangkok, Thailand
officialTitle: Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Daily Tenofovir to Prevent HIV Infection Among Injection Drug Users in Bangkok, Thailand
summary: The primary goals of this study are to assess the safety and efficacy of daily tenofovir to prevent parenteral HIV infection among injection drug users (IDUs). Assessment of changes in HIV associated risk behaviors, adherence to study drug, and, among IDU who become HIV-infected during the trial, evaluation of HIV viral load set point, CD4 counts, genetic characterization of infecting HIV viruses, and antiretroviral resistance will also be done.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented seroconversion or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed for an average of 4.0 years, with a maximum duration of 6.9 years
